info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 23 at 3:20PM EST until February 24 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations of up to one inch over the southern Adirondacks and ice accumulations of a light glaze to up to one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...The northern Catskills, Schoharie Valley, Mohawk Valley, Greater Capital Region, Helderbergs, southern Adirondacks and the Lake George Saratoga Region and the northern Taconics. * WHEN...Until 1 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light freezing drizzle will become periods of freezing rain and plain rain mixed with some sleet tonight before changing to snow and some rain showers along and south of the Interstate 90 corridor towards midnight. The precipitation will diminish in the early morning hours with scattered showers and flurries.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
